alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 12:13PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact areas near Clints Well through 1245 PM MST... At 1212 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clints Well, moving south at 10 to 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rain, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Geronimo Estates, Clints Well, Washington Park, Geronimo Boy Scout Camp, Clints Well Campground, Blue Ridge Campground, Rock Crossing Campground and Kehl Springs Campground. This includes State Route 87 between mile markers 281 and 300. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
